Text:
I'm curious as to why my image is not rotating, it ends up in the same same position every time. 

    img = Image.open(r'C:\\Users\\Brett\\Downloads\\testing.jpg')
    exif_data = {
        TAGS[k]: v
        for k, v in img._getexif().items()
        if k in TAGS
    }
    print(exif_data['Orientation'])

That outputs a '6'

Not matter how many degrees I tell the image to rotate it ends up in the same position. 

    if exif_data['Orientation'] == 6:
        img.rotate(90)

or

    if exif_data['Orientation'] == 6:
        img.rotate(270) 
or

    if exif_data['Orientation'] == 6:
        img.rotate(180)

I always end up with an image rotated 90 degrees counter-clockwise. Am I doing something obviously wrong?
